name: Barefoot Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Renovated hotel that is right on the sugar sand beach. They have done a very nice job updating the rooms. Ours was beach front which was terrific. Easy walk to John's Pass to eat and shop. They were nice enough to let us extend our check out time without any issues. Would definitely return. Something that could be improved upon would be the quality of the bed pillows. Also, internet connection was spotty.
reviews.title: Location, location

reviews.text: We happened upon Barefoot Beach Hotel recently and had a fantastic visit (4 nights). It was instantaneously soothing to have the beach right there with the gulf breeze and sounds that we enjoyed on the balcony and inside the room! I was hugely impressed by Heath, Aaron, and Cindy in terms of customer service (and finding great customer service can be surprising these days!) I also loved that a basket is left outside the room to exchange towels and supplies daily so we didn't have to straighten up for the housekeeper to come in. It pained us to leave... I definitely want to come back for a romantic vacation soon.
reviews.title: Definitely a WOW experience!

reviews.text: This is not a hotel unless you never been in a hotel!This is a upgrade motel .I had to take some pictures and call the staff on call to show it the torn mattress,dirt and trash around the bed ,cock roach and leaving dirty towel in the same basket to be replace with clean one in addition with coffee paper towel and etc.I strongly believe this is not a HOTEL and wondering who gave these positive feedback ?.I did not have a good experience at this place and now I know why misleading the public about there is only two room available.DO NOT BELIEVE IT LOTS OF ROOM EMPTY.All together for over $600.00 FOR X3 NIGHTS YOU HAVE MUCH BETTER OPTION.
reviews.title: hotel?

reviews.text: I have stayed on the gulf side of Florida on numerous occasions. Basically all the accommodation is comparable. What I look for is cleanliness and view (will spend most of the time outside anyway). The pool was on the smallish side. All in all, a good-great place, with friendly staff.
reviews.title: Nice place to call home for a week or two!

reviews.text: We have stayed at Barefoot Beach twice. Being Florida natives that have moved out of state we know this area very well! We have a large family and Barefoot accommodates well. My husband grills out by the pool and we had friends and family come visit us while here......the staff goes above and beyond. When our youngest son locked the key in the room after the Office had closed on a Holiday weekend the nice lady in the office came from home to let us back in. Thanks for the great stay and we look forward to seeing you again next year!!
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Stay!!!
very nice
reviews.text: This is a great little motel lovely location , lovely pool , excellent clean room . Would stay again . Great view from our sea view balcony . If I were to be critical in any way would have liked some house keeping , but as we were only here 3 nights this didnt bother us .

Came to barefoot after being disappointed in another condo down the street. Aaron helped us with a great deal. He let us check out the room before booking. Rooms were clean, had a great view, and a good location. Pool was small and located in near the parking lot. Overall, it was a great stay! We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Great location, we came upon this place last year and Came Back! Staff is SUPER attentive and friendly, rooms are different according to your needs and what you want to spend. For our family of 4, last year we had the 2 bedroom ocean front suite. It was great as we had more time to spend there. This year we only stayed 2 nights and opted for the 1 bedroom efficiency, which was smaller but still as nice as larger room. The new pull out sofa was nice and soft. I found myself on that as the beds mattress was too hard for my back. We were able to have our breakfast and lunch/snacks there with mini fridge and microwave and walk to Johns Pass for dinner and shopping. We were able to arrive a little earlier so our girls could not waste any time playing on the beach, swimming,and dolphin/ manatee watching!!! As last year no one wanted to go back to Fort Lauderdale!! Funny Huh!!??
reviews.title: Our Gulf Coast getaway from our East Coast home!

reviews.text: This was a very nice little hotel right on the beach. The view from our room was lovely. The pool was quite small but very clean and well kept. The room itself was alright. There wasn't a lot of extra room...we had three cases as we were away for four weeks. So it was a tight squeeze. The air conditioning was in the corner of the room blowing onto where the kids were sleeping on a pull out bed. They found if very cold there and couldn't sleep so we had to swap beds...the pull out bed was not that comfortable. The kitchen was very small and not suitable for cooking at all. We just had our breakfast there. It was a few minutes walk into the town which was quite nice. There wasn't a great selection of places to eat but we managed. There are nice shops in the area. But all in all we enjoyed our stay there. The staff were lovely and so helpful.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay by the beach

reviews.text: My daughters and I stayed in a Beachfront Studio. The kitchenette had everything that was needed, bathroom and room was very clean. The view from the balcony to the beach and Gulf was amazing. Cindy & Heath was always friendly and helpful..the only complaint I have is that the mattress in the bed was extremely hard, I woke up everyday with my body hurting. Everything else was just perfect
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night, wished it had been longer. Lovely clean rooms. Ours had a ocean view. A perfect place to watch the sunset and get engaged. The next morning we had a lovely walk along the beach. Paddling with the Pelicans in the beautiful clean warm ocean.
reviews.title: Paradise on the Gulf Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here beginning of June for 3 nights and just loved our beach view.We saw dolphins a couple of times. There was a pod of dolphins with a baby and they came quite close in to shore.This hotel is well situated with Johns Pass only 5 min walk away.The room was clean and had everything we needed.The staff were fantastic as on the day we were checking out there was a tropical storm with very high winds and really heavy rain. The guys in reception(sorry I don't remember your names) were brilliant and wouldn't let us drive in the awful weather. They gave us back the key ,supplied us with coffee and told us to stay as long as we wanted until the storm was over.How good is that!!!. We would love to come back again sometime.
reviews.title: Just perfect Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I recently stayed at BBH for two nights to celebrate a 3 year cancer free milestone and our 37th wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Simply Relaxing Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our gulf front studio with balcony and kitchenette was very quiet, clean, comfortable and spacious enough for the two of us. We saw dolphins swimming as soon as we walked out on our balcony! Kitchenette items were clean and included toaster and coffee maker, eating utensils and a small dining table so we were able to bring our own breakfast and snack items and enjoy the gulf view as we ate. The couch was a bit worn in spots but comfy and pleasantly soft against sun kissed and wave whacked skin. . I personally found the studio to be setup just the way I would want it if I had a beach apartment.
reviews.title: Awesome Anniversary!!

reviews.text: We wholeheartedly agree with all the recent positive postings regarding reasonably quiet a/c, good showers and close proximity of St. John’s Pass with its interesting array of shops and restaurants. Not having to drive anywhere and find parking to visit shops and restaurants was a plus. In fact, between the beach and pool and St.John’s Pass, we kept busy enough that we didn’t plug into the internet once or watch TV which is really saying something.
reviews.title: Nice Beach Digs

reviews.text: We got a great rate through Hotwire to stay here during the week. Stayed for 2 nights. They have what you would expect form a beachfront hotel in this area. Nice pool, convenient beach access and outdoor showers to clean off. The front desk was helpful, but is not staffed at all hours. We usually rent a condo, so this doesnt really bother us. I would stay here again if we got a similar rate.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: From our beachfront room we could choose to watch kite surfers or go down to the beach to swim. The sea was a warm 25 degrees ( 80+) and the sand , soft white powder. The pool was excellent.
reviews.title: Truly barefoot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The unit was functional - microwave, good frig and good air con., good hot showers.
reviews.title: Simply perfect

reviews.text: There was no maid service but this didn't matter. We were supplied with clean towels each day.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach!

reviews.text: There was no where much to dine out. I would recommend taking food or visiting a supermarket soon after arrival.
reviews.title: Charge for everything!!!!

description: 43 room beachfront hotel. We are located 2 blocks from John's Pass Village where all the shops and dining are. We provide our guests with a friendly and accommodating experience that will keep them coming back for years! Our staff loves the property and its appearance and comfort reflect this. You will wake up to dolphins playing in the Gulf of Mexico and watch breathtaking sunsets that will last a lifetime! Come stay with us and experience what all the talk is about at the Barefoot Beach Hotel!
